At BigID, our team is the foundation of our success. Join a people-centric culture that is fast-paced and rewarding: you'll have the opportunity to work with some of the most talented people in the industry who value innovation, diversity, integrity, and collaboration.

**Who we seek:**



We are expanding our Solutions Engineering team. We're always looking for top Engineers to join our winning team. This team works closely with innovative companies interested in leveraging BigID's platform. You will use your knowledge to influence customer decisions, provide insightful solutions, and drive successful proof-of-value implementations. With your potent technical capabilities, critical and creative thinking, and passion for fast-paced problem-solving, be ready to hit the ground running.


**What you'll do:**


* Work with the Sales team as the technical subject matter expert for BigID's platform during customer calls and presentations
* Use market and technical knowledge to consult on best practices, and offer constructive direction for solution architecture and design
* Stay up-to-date on relevant competitive solutions, products, and services
* Drive customer success with real-world knowledge and recommendations
* Work with the post-sales teams to ensure every customer realizes the value of the BigID Platform and continues to contribute to the success of BigID customers
* Work with Product Management to capture and articulate customer and prospect product enhancement feedback


**What you'll bring:**


* Excellent customer-facing communication and organization skills
* Good troubleshooting abilities and a methodical approach
* Ability to describe complex technical concepts to diverse audiences: executives, business stakeholders, and technology practitioners
* Passion for demonstrating solutions and ability to provide technical input during the sales process
* Broad understanding of enterprise data architecture, privacy, and security technologies
* Ability to plan, execute and close out a Proof of Concept with minimal assistance and oversight
* Desire to share knowledge through excellent documentation creation and RFI/RFP responses
* Some prior experience with one or more of the following: RDBMS systems, no-SQL data stores (MongoDB, Cassandra, DynamoDB), Hadoop technologies (such HDFS, Hive, HBase), cloud technologies (AWS EMR, S3, DynamoDB, Redshift, Azure file and blob storage, etc.)
* Prior experience with Identity and Access Management or Data Loss Prevention tools is a plus
* Experience with Linux or container frameworks (such as Docker) is a strong plus
* Experience with Linux, and container frameworks, such as Kubernetes **required**
* Minimum of 5 years in a pre-sales engineering or consulting role within a multinational environment
* Bachelor's degree in Computer Science or related discipline. (Master's degree a plus)
* **Bi-Lingual in English and Danish or Swedish.**


**Our Values:**


*We look for people who embody our values - Care, Do, Try & Shine.*


* ***Care*** *- We* ***care*** *about our customers and each other*
* ***Do*** *- We* ***do*** *what it takes to make a positive impact*
* ***Try*** *- We* ***try*** *our best and we don't give up*
* ***Shine*** *- We* ***shine*** *and make it our mission to always stand out*


**What's in it for you?!**



Our people are the foundation of our success, and we prioritize offering a wide range of benefits that make our team happier and healthier.


* Equity participation - everyone shares in our success
* Flexible work arrangements
* Other compulsory benefits based on country of residence

title: Functional Safety Engineer
description:
**At Capgemini Engineering, the world leader in engineering services, we bring together a global team of engineers, scientists, and architects to help the world’s most innovative companies unleash their potential. From autonomous cars to life-saving robots, our digital and software technology experts think outside the box as they provide unique R&D and engineering services across all industries. Join us for a career full of opportunities. Where you can make a difference. Where no two days are the same.**

**Functional Safety Engineer**
------------------------------

**As the Functional Safety Engineer, you will be responsible to create, foster and sustain system safety processes, methods, tools, and training within our global Engineering organization. You will ensure conformance with ISO 26262 & ISO 21448 standards and provide expert support to various teams regarding functional safety processes. Your role will also involve conducting confirmation reviews of system safety. The role is an integrated part of our System Safety Competence Center (SSCC) where a team of (System Safety Leaders) SSLs are together achieving the long-term goals of ensuring and delivering safe products within the System Safety area. System Safety includes Functional Safety (FUSA) as well as Safety of the Intended Functionality (SOTIF).**  



**Functional Safety is an aspect that must be considered when developing cars. Functional Safety is concerned with handling faults and functional insufficiencies in electrical/electronic hardware and software to avoid harm to persons. Functional Safety is about handling safety issues caused by malfunctions due to systematic and random faults in electrical/electronic hardware and software. SOTIF is about achieving a safe functional behavior and nominal performance (including technical limitations) of electrical/electronic hardware and software.**

  

**Key r** **esponsibilities:**

* **Drive the implementation of ISO 26262 & ISO 21448 and system safety processes across the organization.**
* **Develop and maintain system safety methods, tools, and best practices.**
* **Conduct awareness and training sessions to enhance the organization's understanding of system safety, principles, standards and way of working.**
* **Provide expert support and guidance on system safety processes to various departments, including engineers and managers.**
* **Perform confirmation reviews of system safety work products to ensure compliance with ISO 26262.**
* **Collaborate with cross-functional teams to integrate safety processes into product development.**
* **Stay up to date with industry trends and advancements in system safety and international standards.**
* **Develop and maintain a good System Safety Culture within Engineering, e.g. by sharing experiences in our internal Community of Practice.**
**Qualifications:**
-------------------

* **M.Sc. in Controls and Mechatronics, Electrical/Electronic or Computer Science Engineering or equal. Advanced degree preferred.**
* **Minimum 4 years of experience in Functional Safety**
* **Good knowledge of systems engineering including embedded SW/HW in the automotive domain.**
* **Good knowledge of system safety engineering practices, safety standards and product safety.**
* **Deep knowledge in the automotive relevant system safety standards e.g. (ISO 26262, ISO 21448)**
* **Experience in risk assessment and analysis methodologies (HARA, FTA, FMEDA, FMEA) and processes/methods/tools for functional safety and safety of the intended functionality.**
* **Very good in English, both written and spoken**
* **Flexible, enthusiastic, methodical, analytical, and with high professional integrity**
* **Self-motivated and able to drive initiatives**
* **Excellent collaboration skills**
* **Ability to work collaboratively with cross-functional teams.**

  

**Capgemini Engineering offers you a work environment that is characterized by innovation. As a consultant at Capgemini Engineering, you are part of something bigger. We care about you as a colleague and offer you a safe and favorable employment. For us, the community is important and in addition to professional development, we offer you a variety of activities such as lunches, breakfasts, after works, sports events and more.**

  

**Join us and** **Get The Future You Want!**

  

**Welcome with your application!**  



**#LI-JM16**

**Capgemini is a global business and technology transformation partner, helping organizations to accelerate their dual transition to a digital and sustainable world, while creating tangible impact for enterprises and society. It is a responsible and diverse group of 340,000 team members in more than 50 countries. With its strong over 55-year heritage, Capgemini is trusted by its clients to unlock the value of technology to address the entire breadth of their business needs. It delivers end-to-end services and solutions leveraging strengths from strategy and design to engineering, all fuelled by its market leading capabilities in AI, cloud and data, combined with its deep industry expertise and partner ecosystem. The Group reported 2023 global revenues of €22.5 billion.**

title: Team Manager - Collaboration
description:
**T E A M M A N A G E R**  

*Collaboration*  

**\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_**  

Full-time | Permanent | Göteborg/Malmö

 **A B O U T X E N I T**  

Xenit is a growth company which specializes in Cloud and modern work. Our committed employees inspire, challenge and encourage each other, while providing extensive value for our customers.  

Xenit is **Microsoft's Partner of the Year, Sweden** for 2024, illustrating our commitment to technical development, being on the cutting edge of tech, and our close partnership with Microsoft. (A large portion of this achievement can be attributed to the work of our engineers within our collaboration team, for their focus on Copilot)  

  

  

  

**W H A T W E N E E D**  

We are looking for a talented person within collaboration services **(Microsoft 365, SharePoint, Teams, Copilot, Identity & Security)** who will take on technical and operational responsibility for the Collaboration Team.
  

We're looking for someone who comes from a background as an engineer/consultant, who has either recently taken a step into leadership, or would like to do so now.  

The split of management vs. technical delivery is **70/30%** for this position and so although managing your team will take up a large portion of your work, you will still be expected to work as a consultant in some part. This is why we need someone who still has a foot into the tech, and really knows the ins and outs of the collaboration sphere  

  

*Note: We would prefer if this person was sitting in Goteborg, or potentially in Malmo (in order to be a little closer to their team, and connected to a larger office space).*  

  

**Examples of potential tasks:**  

* **1 to 1s** with your team members
* **Salary reviews/negotiations** each year
* **Recruitment:** Deciding on needs, working closely with our Head of Talent in the recruitment process, interviewing candidates, job offering
* **Pre-sale Engineering:** Providing technical guidance to both business managers and sales teams in customer discussions
* **Responsibility for Service Delivery:** Ensure optimal use of the teams competence into assignments and managed service delivery
* Working closely with Business Manager on strategy, and how best to implement for operational success.
* **Solution Architecture and/or technical implementation** within the collaboration sphere (very much dependent on skill set/level of chosen candidate).

  

**C O U L D Y O U B E A M A T C H ?**  

**We believe our next Team Manager has:**  

* **6****+ years** within the collaboration sphere (365, SharePoint, Teams, Entra ID, Identity)
* Previous consulting work and good experience with a variety of customers
* Experience with pre-sale, design & architecture
* A confident, senior presence in general

  

**It is a bonus if you have:**  

* Previous management/team leading experience (with positive results, of course!)
* An existing network of customers
 **We also believe that you are a person who:**  

* Acts on their own initiative, makes things happen and takes **responsibility** for their work
* Wants to get the best out of their team, and focuses on team career development and satisfaction
* Is **available** and **present** for their team members when needed


- Has good communication skills - is open, transparent and direct in their instruction  

* Fluent in spoken and written Swedish AND English
* Above all else, displays kindness and compassion in everything they do

  

Pictured: Jan Frick, Expert Engineer (left) and Victor Nasslander, Team Manager of Workspace (right) **W H Y C H O O S E X E N I T ?**  

**Benefits**  

Xenit boasts a large benefits package, read full list here.  

  

**Super interesting colleagues**  

With us you will find spinning instructors, parkour practitioners, gamers, art historians, rugby players, puzzle maniacs, film geeks and much more.  

With us, you are free to be who you are. Our workforce is so diverse, that one of the only things each person has in common is an incredible drive and passion for what they do.  

  

**Activities**  

Each quarter, we host **Xenit Inspire** where employees are able to share specialist knowledge, information about cool projects, and take part in tasks centered around innovation - workshops and hackathons. We also offer annual conferences, team building, after works, and "Bring a Buddy" lunches at the office.  

  

Last year, Xenit was awarded **"Career Company of 2024"**. This prestigious recognition underscores our commitment to fostering a workplace culture that values inclusivity, well-being, and growth.  

*"Xenit is an outstanding employer where corporate culture and well-being are at the center. Here, the employees are part of a warm and inclusive community where their well-being and well-being are prioritized. By offering an environment where collaboration, creativity and innovation are encouraged, employees can thrive and develop while contributing to the company's success."*  

**Read more about Karriar Företagen** **here****.**

title: Senior Cloud & FinOps Engineer
description:
- **Är du en duktig molningenjör med passion för både tekniska lösningar och kostnadsoptimering? Vill du arbeta i skärningspunkten mellan molntjänster och ekonomi? Då kan Devoteam M Cloud vara platsen för dig!**  

  

Är du redo att rulla upp skjortärmarna och delta i äventyret?
  

Vi ser fram emot att höra från dig!
  

  

**Devoteam** är ett ledande internationellt konsultföretag som arbetar med digitala transformationer. Vi har över 10 000 kollegor i 20 länder.
  

  

Vi på **Devoteam M Cloud** är specialiserade på Microsoft Azure och blev bland annat utsedda till Partner of the Year (Norge) av Microsoft 2023. Vi söker nu fler duktiga kollegor som vill vara med och skapa fantastiska molnresor för våra kunder. Hos oss möter du en miljö som inte bara handlar om teknisk innovation, utan också om att ha roligt på jobbet! Våra medarbetare brinner för att leverera de bästa lösningarna inom Azure, optimering och modernisering.

  
**Ansvar**

* Automatisera molntjänster och kostnadsoptimering: Skapa säkra och skalbara lösningar som ger fullständig insyn i kostnaderna med verktyg som PowerBI och Infrastructure as Code (IaC).
* Spela en nyckelroll i kundens FinOps-resa: Du kommer att hjälpa våra kunder att förstå och förbättra sina molnkostnader, vilket säkerställer att deras investeringar ger maximalt värde
* Arbeta nära med tvärfunktionella team: Tillsammans med kunden, våra tekniker och utvecklare kommer du att leverera holistiska, smarta lösningar som verkligen gör skillnad.

  
**Kvalifikationer**

* Praktisk erfarenhet av att jobba med Infrastruktur som kod (IaC)
* Minst 3 års praktisk erfarenhet med molntjänster (Azure, AWS og Google Cloud)
* Du har gedigen erfarenhet av att skapa intuitiva PowerBI-instrumentpaneler som ger kunderna full insikt i deras kostnadslandskap.
Du är en problemlösare som arbetar bra med både tekniska och ekonomiska intressenter.  
* 

  

**Personliga egenskaper**

* Du har ett strukturerat arbetssätt och förmåga att se både helheten och detaljerna
* Du är lösningsorienterad och har en proaktiv inställning till problemlösning
* Stark förmåga att samarbeta, samtidigt som du tycker om att arbeta självständigt
* Du är nyfiken på ny teknik och vill ständigt utveckla din kompetens

  
- **Vi erbjuder:**


	* Möjligheten att arbeta i en dynamisk och innovativ miljö med spännande kunder och projekt
	* Konkurrenskraftiga villkor och utvecklingsmöjligheter inom både teknik och karriär
	* En professionell miljö där kunskapsdelning och kontinuerligt lärande är en del av kulturen
	* Tillgång till de senaste tekniska verktygen och plattformarna för att effektivt lösa komplexa utmaningarHos oss får du möjlighet att använda din expertis för att bygga framtidens
  

dataplattformar, samtidigt som du arbetar nära innovativa projekt som skapar mätbara
  

resultat. Vi söker en person som är redo för nya utmaningar och som vill utvecklas vidare i en spännande och framtidsorienterad miljö.
  

**Är det här du? Vi ser fram emot att höra från dig!**

title: Machine Learning Engineer
description:
Trustly is leading the human-centric payments revolution. To us, this means passionately building the most convenient, intelligent and responsible way of paying for things online. Whether it’s for shopping, paying subscriptions, funding trading accounts, booking airfare, playing online games and much more – we’re all about a better way to pay. At our core, we are a tech company with industry-leading tech capabilities. But, it’s the ingenuity of our people that makes us leaders in our field. Thus, our appetite for innovation will never be anything less than fierce. Trustly is steadily growing as it connects thousands of businesses with hundreds of millions of people. And with a strong presence across Europe and the Americas, we are leading the human-centric payment revolution as a truly global team.
 




  





**About the Data domain
 

 The Data domain is part of the Product and Tech function with the mission of transforming Trustly into a truly data-driven organization. We are responsible for every aspect of the data journey, from collection & modeling to analysis and visualization. We provide the whole organization with data and analytics artifacts aiming to improve our decisions, operations and the customer’s experience.
 








**About the role
 

 We are seeking a talented Machine Learning Engineer to join our Machine Learning team. As a Machine Learning Engineer, you will work on building and deploying machine learning models that will help drive and automate critical business decisions within our product services. You will have the opportunity to work on cutting-edge ML applications, collaborate with a multidisciplinary team, and take ownership of end-to-end machine learning lifecycles. If you're passionate about ML and AI, problem-solving, and building scalable solutions, we’d love to have you on board.
 





  




**What you’ll do** 
* **Model Development & Optimization:** 
 Develop end-to-end pipelines to deploy machine learning models into production environments and continuously improve model performance through feature selection, hyperparameter tuning and model lifecycle management
* **Data Pipeline Design & Management:** 
 Build and maintain efficient data pipelines for data collection, preprocessing, and feature transformation to ensure high-quality near real-time input for ML models
* **Performance Monitoring:** 
 Monitor and evaluate feature drift and the performance of deployed models, ensuring they meet business requirements and adjusting as necessary to maintain a high level of model performance over time
* **Collaborate Across Teams:** 
 Work closely with data scientists, software engineers, architects and product managers to understand the business needs and translate them into scalable machine learning products
* **Stay Ahead of Trends:** 
 Keep up with the latest advancements in machine learning and AI technologies, applying new methodologies and tools to enhance the effectiveness of your work



  




**Who you are** 
* **Experience:** 
 You have 5+ years of hands-on experience developing and deploying machine learning models in a production environment with near real-time latency
* **Education:** 
 You have a Master’s degree in Computer Science, Engineering, Mathematics, or a related field


**Technical Skills:** 
* Proficient in programming languages like Python, Java, or C++
* Experience with ML frameworks such as Sagemaker, MLFlow, TensorFlow, Keras, PyTorch and similar frameworks
* Strong understanding of machine learning algorithms, statistics, and optimization techniques
* Experience working with ML Operations, model lifecycle, infrastructure as code and CI/CD pipelines for model deployment
* Familiarity with cloud platforms like AWS, Google Cloud, and deploying ML models at scale in said platforms
* Experience with big data tools and distributed computing (e.g., Spark, Apache Beam/Flink)
* Experience working with streaming data pipelines in Kafka (or similar)
* Knowledge of version control systems (e.g., Git) and containerization tools (e.g., Docker)
* Experience within open banking is a plus but not required






  




  



 Are you someone who voices new ideas and acts on them? Do you value great communication with all stakeholders? We are looking to strengthen the team with dedicated, highly motivated people who thrive in working with different areas across the organisation.
 









 If you feel that your skill set and personality compliments the criteria above, apply now and k
 

 indly submit your CV in English.****

title: Fullstack Product Engineer
description:
**Join Scratx and build products that liberate Financial Operations from manual spreadsheets and hardcoded applications!** 




  





 Are you a scrappy and resourceful fullstack engineer looking to build software products from scratch using future-proof technology, without legacy constraints? 
 



  





 If you're excited about creating the next generation financial data processing and operations automation platform for high-volume transaction businesses, we want to hear from you.
 



  





**Who We Are:** 




 Scratx, founded in 2023, is on a mission to liberate financial operations in digital, e-commerce, and retail businesses. Our goal is to empower companies with greater freedom and independence through self-serve, no-code tools that streamline transaction data harmonization and automate repetitive tasks like revenue recognition, payment reconciliation, and tax reporting.
 



  





 At Scratx, we value experimentation, creativity, and a shared ambition to build something truly great. We believe in creating delightful customer experiences while enjoying the process of building a business and innovative products.
 



  





 Learn more about us at scratx.com/about-scratx.
 



  





**Who You Are:** 



* A skilled fullstack software engineer with a proven track record in software development (including hobby projects and education).
* Experienced in building backend applications and working with system integrations through APIs.
* Experienced in building frontend user friendly interfaces.
* Experienced in building infrastructure in cloud environments such as Azure, AWS and Google Cloud.
* Experienced in working with commonly used frameworks for platform development such as C#, .NET, Python, React, Typescript, Python, PostgreSQL, Docker, Kubernetes, etc.
* Preferably you've worked with applications that depend on large datasets and high-speed processing power.
* Ambitious, with a long-term vision for your work and a strong desire to join a startup committed to building future-proof technology.
* Experience from working in startups, e-commerce, payments and / or B2B SaaS businesses is highly preferred.
* Open-minded, kind-hearted, and full of energy.
* Clear about your professional goals and values, and able to communicate them authentically.



  





**What You’ll Do:** 



* Build core applications and features, both backend and frontend, on our platform from scratch, or when appropriate leverage the latest and/or best frameworks available open source or as a service.
* Collaborate closely with the CTO and development team
* Build new generation AI features, integrating to LLMs, both operating backend and deployed frontend in the Scratx user interface.



  





**What We Offer:** 



* The opportunity to join an early-stage startup and have a significant impact, with the freedom to experiment and innovate alongside an ambitious, kindhearted and tight team.
* A competitive salary, appropriate for a startup environment.
* Equity opportunities: option packages will be available for key team members with long-term commitment.
* We require that you are based in Stockholm so that we can work closely together, but we operate with a loosely structured hybrid model.



  





 Questions before you apply? Reach out to hello@scratx.com

title: Machine Learning Engineer & Data Engineer
description:
Drivs du av att arbeta med data och utveckla lösningar som gör verklig skillnad? Hos Amendo Tech får du chansen att arbeta i framkant inom machine learning och data engineering för några av Sveriges mest spännande företag. Just nu söker vi drivna och lösningsorienterade specialister för kommande uppdrag inom bank och finans, detaljhandel, myndigheter, produktbolag och snabbväxande startups. Vi erbjuder unika möjligheter för dig som är redo för en ny, stimulerande utmaning.
   

  

**Din kompetens & profil**
**Machine Learning Engineer**
 Vi söker dig som har gedigen erfarenhet av att bygga och implementera maskininlärningsmodeller och som trivs med att analysera stora mängder data för att skapa insikter och affärsvärde.
   

  

 Vi söker dig som har erfarenhet av ett eller flera av följande områden/verktyg:
   

  

* Programmering: Stark kompetens inom Python, Java eller Scala.
* ML-ramverk: Erfarenhet av verktyg som TensorFlow, PyTorch, Scikit-Learn eller Keras.
* Modellutveckling: Kompetens inom modellträning, optimering och hyperparameter-tuning.
* Prediktiv modellering: Erfarenhet av regression, klassificering, klustring och djupinlärning.
* Databehandling: Vana vid dataförbehandling och analys, gärna med verktyg som Pandas, NumPy och Dask.
* Molntjänster: Erfarenhet av ML-pipelines på AWS SageMaker, Azure ML eller Google Cloud AI.
* MLOps: Erfarenhet av CI/CD-principer för ML och verktyg som MLflow, Kubeflow, eller TensorFlow Extended (TFX).
* Analytisk förmåga: Förmåga att tolka och kommunicera resultat till både tekniska och icke-tekniska intressenter


**Data Engineer**
 Vi söker även dig som är erfaren inom data engineering och kan bygga skalbara dataplattformar, pipelines och integrationer som möjliggör analys och avancerad datamodellering.
   

  

 Vi söker dig som har erfarenhet av ett eller flera av följande områden/verktyg:
   

  

* Programmering och scripting: Erfarenhet av Python, Java, Scala, eller SQL.
* Dataplattformar och pipelines: Kunskap om verktyg som Apache Spark, Apache Kafka, Airflow, eller DBT.
* Molntjänster: Erfarenhet av att bygga och hantera dataflöden i molnmiljöer som AWS (Glue, Redshift), Azure (Data Factory, Synapse) eller Google Cloud (BigQuery, Dataflow).
* Data Lakes och Data Warehouses: Erfarenhet av att arbeta med dataarkitektur och lagringslösningar för att hantera stora datamängder.
* ETL/ELT-processer: Erfarenhet av att utveckla effektiva och robusta ETL/ELT-pipelines.
* Big Data-ramverk: Kunskap inom hantering och bearbetning av stora datamängder med exempelvis Hadoop, Hive, eller Snowflake.
* Versionshantering och samarbete: God förståelse för versionshantering i Git och vana att arbeta i agila team.
* Data Governance och säkerhet: Förståelse för datahanteringsprinciper, GDPR och dataetik.


 Du har en vilja, nyfikenhet och drivkraft att vilja skapa nytta hos kunden samt lära dig nytt. En problemlösare som inte är rädd för att ta initiativ och vågar utforska nya vägar och arbetssätt. Du har en förmåga att snabbt sätta dig in i nya sammanhang och processer. Du får saker gjorda och ser kunskapsluckor som en möjlighet för personlig utveckling. Du är analytisk och har stor förståelse för vikten av service och kommunikation.
   

  

 Som konsult kommer du att ställas inför en rad olika utmaningar, både från ett socialt och pragmatiskt perspektiv. Därför tror vi att du är öppen och ödmjuk för både förändring och för olikheter. Du har ett agilt sätt att möta problem och kan se dem från olika vinklar.
   

  

**Om Amendo Tech**
 Amendo Tech är din heltäckande partner inom IT och tech. Som vår konsultkollega blir du en del av ett personligt bolag som lägger stor vikt vid kompetens, mångfald och innovation. Vi ser varje medarbetares unika perspektiv som en styrka, och vi erbjuder ett öppet klimat där vi stöttar dig att nå dina mål. Tillsammans bidrar vi till att forma en bättre framtid genom teknik och kreativitet.
   

  

 Vi är ett expansivt bolag med stark lokal närvaro i Stockholm samt i sydvästra och norra Sverige. Följ Amendo Tech på Linkedin!
   

  

 Amendo Tech är en del av Amendo Group som har arbetat med framtidens kompetens sedan 2001. I koncernen ingår även Amendo Bemanning & Rekrytering och Lagotto Executive Search & Interim. Tillsammans möter vi dig där du står, och tar dig dit du vill. Vi är din engagerade och trygga kompetenspartner.
   

  

**Frågor och kontakt**
 Vid frågor eller funderingar om våra konsultuppdrag är du varmt välkommen att höra av dig till Amendo Techs Kiara Bergqvist på kiara.bergqvist@amendotech.se eller Johanna Hallenberg på johanna.hallenberg@amendotech.se. Vi ser fram emot att höra från dig, varmt välkommen med din ansökan!

title: Senior Data Platform Engineer
description:
Vi har nu ett nytt behov och söker därför en konsultkollega med nedan kvalifikationer. Tjänsten är en del av vår konsultverksamhet vilket innebär att du blir anställd av oss och arbetar hos kund alt. interna projekt och åtaganden.
   

  

**Rollen:**
 Vi söker en erfaren Data Engineer som kan bygga lösningar på Azure med Databricks och kan utveckla och hjälpa teamet inom Dev-Ops-området. Vår organisation är liten, så man behöver ta stort eget ansvar och har samtidigt stor möjlighet att påverka hur vi jobbar med.
   

  

**Ska-krav:**
* Kunskap i Azure infrastruktur för dataplattformar
* Kunskap/Erfarenhet av utveckling i Python
* Erfarenhet av uppsättning av cloud-infrastruktur för data teams
* Erfarenhet av Data Engineering och datamodellering
* Erfarenhet av implementering av Databricks
* Erfarenhet av automatiserade releaseprocesser och DevOps
* Erfarenhet av utveckling agil utveckling i praktiken
* Erfarenhet av kravarbete och verksamhetsutveckling
* Erfarenhet av Power BI eller annat visualiseringsverktyg


**Sista ansökningdag: 24-01-2025**
**Om Deploja**
 Vi sysselsätter idag erfarna konsulter, inom bl.a. Systemutveckling, Test, Arkitektur, IT-Projektledning, IT-Säkerhet.
   

  

 Att jobba på Deploja är något helt annat än att arbeta på ett vanligt konsultbolag – och det är vi riktigt stolta över. Vad är det då som gör oss unika?
   

  

 Vi erbjuder helt enkelt mer än bara hög lön och större frihet, det är bara början. Hos oss hittar du den arbetsmiljö och de möjligheter du förtjänar. Välkommen till Deploja, där gräset faktiskt är grönare!
   

  

**Vi erbjuder dig följande, Valet är ditt!**
 🚀 Spännande uppdrag hos våra många kunder. Vi fokuserar på långsiktiga uppdrag, vilket ger dig möjlighet att skapa värde för kunden samtidigt som du utvecklas själv.
   

  

 🌟 En trygg månadslön – tillsammans bestämmer vi en grundlön baserad på dina uppdrag.
   

  

 🚗 Tjänstebil – vi uppmuntrar dig att välja en elbil för en mer hållbar framtid.
   

  

 💼 Tjänstepension och stora möjligheter till löneväxling.
   

  

 🌴 Semester - Önskar du mer än 30 dagar semester, kanske 60 dagar?
   

  

 🏥 Privat sjukvårdsförsäkring, olycksfallsförsäkring och livförsäkring för ökad trygghet.
   

  

 📚 Kompetensutveckling – du får själv sätta din budget och välja vilka utbildningar du vill delta i.
   

  

 🕑 Livskvalitet - Har du kanske svårt att få ihop pusslet i vardagen och önskar arbeta lite mindre och ändå kunna tjäna lika mycket om inte mer?
   

  

* Vi hanterar ansökningar löpande, med hänsyn till höga arbetstrycket är det extra viktigt med en kort motivering för tjänsten som förklarar hur man möter kraven.

title: NetSuite Industry Specialist, EMEA
description:
**Job Description**
 This will be an opportunity to get engaged in sales cycle strategy, customer presentations, marketing initiative and go-to-market (GTM) as well as participating in industry/product meetings, seminars, and round tables to remain up to date on industry and product knowledge. You will be expected to perform an Industry call quarterly to the sales and solution consulting org, updating them with latest trends and analysis for your specific industry.
   

  

 Our team culture is centred around embracing growth mindset, inspiring excellence, and encouraging teams and leaders to bring their best each day. In doing so, we drive innovation and redefine how NetSuite engages with key market segments.
   

  

**Responsibilities:**
* Partner with Sales and Solution Consulting to build and deliver industry presentations during sales engagements. Participation may include customer facing presentations and meetings or behind the scenes strategic planning and education.
* Develop and maintain go-to-market documentation for the Software Industry (e.g., Playbooks, Overview, Personas, Terminology etc.).
* Create demo recordings and videos (internal and external) for the Software Industry.
* Work with marketing on industry specific content and campaigns.
* Deliver industry strategy presentations for key customer events (tradeshows, Conferences webinars, etc.).
* Collaborate with Sales, Solution Consulting, and SDR Enablement teams on Software Industry specific content.
* Provide quarterly industry updates to Sales and Solution Consulting.
* Collaborate with third-party partners to help shape industry strategy (playbooks).
* Attend CAB & Go-to-Market advisory meetings to collaborate with SuiteSuccess, Product Management, and Demo Excellence to ensure consistent messaging for the Software Industry.
* Provide input to Sales on key themes from New Releases as they relate to the Software Industry.
* Identify product gaps and help to solve said gaps with Solution Consultants, partners or collaborate with the product team for future development.
* Mentor/coach team members across the organisation.
* Research industry related topics, trends, and provide analysis and recommendations.
* Manage regular meetings with Sales Leadership to build a strategy for the Software Industry.


**Qualifications**
* A minimum of 5 or more years of overall experience in relevant industry and/or marketing/selling to the relevant industry.
* A minimum of 5 or more years of Oracle NetSuite experience.
* Management experience preferred but not required.
* Self-motivated individual.
* Strong problem-solving skills.
* Strong knowledge of market solutions for relevant industry and cloud trends.
* Strong presentation & product demonstration skills.
* Proven ability to bring teams together and collaborate across organisations.
* Demonstrated ability to establish a winning go to market (GTM) industry strategy.
* Proven ability to establish Trusted Advisor relationships with C-Level Executives (executive presence).
* Excellent communicator / accomplished public speaker.


 Career Level - IC4
   

  

**Responsibilities**
**Detailed Description and Job Requirements**
 Oracle NetSuite is on the hunt for an Industry Specialist to spearhead their Software Industry vertical sales efforts. This role is designed to empower the sales and solution consulting teams with industry-specific knowledge and strategies. The ideal candidate will have extensive experience in the Software Industry, coupled with a strong understanding of Oracle NetSuite's capabilities.
   

  

 The Industry Specialist will collaborate across various teams to develop compelling industry presentations, assets, and go-to-market strategies. They will be responsible for creating and delivering customer-centric content, including demos and industry-specific campaigns. This role involves staying up to date with industry trends, providing insights to the sales team, and contributing to product development by identifying gaps.
   

  

 With a focus on mentorship and knowledge sharing, the Industry Specialist will coach team members and maintain strong relationships with third-party partners. Excellent communication skills, a collaborative mindset, and a proven ability to develop winning industry strategies are key to success in this role. Join Oracle NetSuite to make a significant impact on their Software Industry sales performance and market presence. Travel required when needed.
   

  

**Why work at Oracle**
* Join a global workplace where you can make an impact.
* We offer competitive salaries and exciting benefits – along with flexible and remote working to suit your lifestyle.
* Get access to development opportunities that can advance your career, an Employee Assistance Program to support your mental health, and core benefits such as medical, life insurance, and access to retirement planning.
* Be yourself in an inclusive culture where employee resource groups champion our diverse communities.


**What We’ll Offer You**
* A competitive salary with exciting benefits
* Flexible and remote working so you can do your best work
* Learning and development opportunities to advance your career
* An Employee Assistance Program to support your mental health
* Employee resource groups that champion our diverse communities
* Core benefits such as medical, life insurance, and access to retirement planning
* An inclusive culture that celebrates what makes you unique


**Life at Oracle and Equal Opportunity**
 An Oracle career can span industries, roles, Countries and cultures, giving you the opportunity to flourish in new roles and innovate, while blending work life in. Oracle has thrived through 40+ years of change by innovating and operating with integrity while delivering for the top companies in almost every industry.
   

  

 In order to nurture the talent that makes this happen, we are committed to an inclusive culture that celebrates and values diverse insights and perspectives, a workforce that inspires thought leadership and innovation.
   

  

 At Oracle, we believe that innovation starts with diversity and inclusion and to create the future we need talent from various backgrounds, perspectives, and abilities. We ensure that individuals with disabilities are provided reasonable accommodation to successfully participate in the job application, interview process, and in potential roles to perform crucial job functions.
   

  

 That’s why we’re committed to creating a workforce where all individuals can do their best work. It’s when everyone’s voice is heard and valued that we’re inspired to go beyond what’s been done before.
   

  

*https://www.oracle.com/corporate/careers/diversity-inclusion/*
**About Us**
 As a world leader in cloud solutions, Oracle uses tomorrow’s technology to tackle today’s problems. True innovation starts with diverse perspectives and various abilities and backgrounds.
   

  

 When everyone’s voice is heard, we’re inspired to go beyond what’s been done before. It’s why we’re committed to expanding our inclusive workforce that promotes diverse insights and perspectives.
   

  

 We’ve partnered with industry-leaders in almost every sector—and continue to thrive after 40+ years of change by operating with integrity.
   

  

 Oracle careers open the door to global opportunities where work-life balance flourishes. We offer a highly competitive suite of employee benefits designed on the principles of parity and consistency. We put our people first with flexible medical, life insurance and retirement options. We also encourage employees to give back to their communities through our volunteer programs.
   

  

 We’re committed to including people with disabilities at all stages of the employment process. If you require accessibility assistance or accommodation for a disability at any point, let us know by calling +1 888 404 2494, option one.
   

  

**Disclaimer:**
 Oracle is an Equal Employment Opportunity Employer\*. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, sexual orientation, gender identity, disability and protected veterans’ status, or any other characteristic protected by law. Oracle will consider for employment qualified applicants with arrest and conviction records pursuant to applicable law.
   

  

* Which includes being a United States Affirmative Action Employer

title: Test and Verification Engineer
description:
10% of Europe’s CO₂ emissions are caused by residential heating and energy bills are out of control. Aira is here to change that.


With our intelligent Aira Heat Pump at the heart, we’re making the switch to clean energy-tech easier and more affordable. Helping Europe turn off gas and slashing energy costs one home at a time.


Founded in 2022, and with 1000+ employees and counting, Aira is driving the clean energy revolution by providing homes with modern clean energy-tech solutions such as solar power, battery storage solutions and heat pumps. With a state-of-the-art production facility in Poland, an HQ in Stockholm, Sweden. In Helsingborg, where this role is located, Aira has built a brand new development center. We have hubs across the UK, Germany and Italy, Aira is well on track to install clean energy-tech into 5 million homes by 2034.


**About the role**

Our **Test and Verification Department** is expanding, and we are looking for a **Test and Verification Engineer** to join our team. In this role, you will primarily focus on conducting tests and measurements in our lab and analyzing the results. You will actively set up and operate heat pumps under various conditions while performing electrical and mechanical tests, as well as minor modifications to heat pump systems. Collaboration with the refrigeration, electrical, and mechanical teams will be a key part of your responsibilities.

 **What you will be doing:**

  

* Setting up, connecting, and conducting tests and measurements.
* Troubleshooting system issues, including both hardware and software.
* Performing minor modifications to heat pump systems.
* Analyzing measurement data to draw actionable conclusions.
* Writing detailed test reports and documentation.
* Developing test cases and procedures.
* Testing software functionalities.
* Contributing to the continuous improvement of work processes.

 **What we would like you to have:**

* Knowledge in energy systems, physics, electronics, or a related field.
* Proficiency in refrigeration technology and thermodynamics (prefered but not mandatory).
* Experience in testing hardware products, ideally heat pumps or HVAC systems (not required but beneficial).
* Basic software knowledge.
* Hands-on experience in electrical or HVAC work (preferred).


Additionally, we value:

* A proactive and entrepreneurial mindset, along with adaptability to manage frequent and fast changes.
* A preference for a blend of practical and theoretical tasks.
* Quick learning abilities and a solution-oriented approach.
* A willingness to thrive in a dynamic startup environment, often requiring proactive initiative.
* Strong communication and collaboration skills.




**What is in it for you?**

* Gain hands-on experience in a fast-growing scale-up, with a supportive and inclusive culture, and career advancement opportunities.
* Collaborate with diverse teams across international markets and launch products globally.
* Develop and grow personally and professionally in an entrepreneurial-minded environment.
* Thrive in a dynamic, solution-oriented culture, tackling challenges and driving meaningful solutions that make a positive impact on the world.
* Influence the company's success, with a visible impact on product development and market growth.
* You will be working at Aira's brand new development center located at Berga in Helsingborg.


At Aira, we champion next-generation energy as well as diversity and inclusion. We firmly believe that a diverse workforce fosters innovation and creativity, enhancing our ability to serve customers and communities effectively. We welcome individuals from all backgrounds, cultures and perspectives to join our team. Our commitment is to uphold equality and inclusivity, fostering a collaborative environment where everyone can thrive and contribute to a better future for our people and the planet.
company_description: We are Aira. A Scandinavian company on a mission to disrupt residential heating by empowering people to join the clean energy revolution, one home at a time.

title: System Engineer
description:
**System Engineer**

*For over 160 years, Ascom has driven innovation. With over 1300 employees, we are a global provider of ICT and mobility solutions, focusing on developing business-critical, real-time solutions for environments where mobility, stability, and time are central factors.*


You haveprobably benefited from an Ascom solution without knowing it. Our solutions work behind the scenes, such as clinical communication and alarms in hospitals, welfare technology in elderly care, security systems in prisons and mobile alarm systems. We are helping to digitalize the healthcare sector in Sweden and our solutions ensure that both patients and staff feel safer. In other words, working with us is a serious and exciting task – that's why we hire the very best and do our utmost to retain and strengthen them!


**At Ascom Sweden**, we are a total of 240 colleagues, many of whom have extensive expertise and long-term employment, and are the most skilled in their field. Your career development through collaboration and training is important to us, and you will have opportunities to participate in global and local initiatives, and projects internally.


We are now looking for a new colleague to join our Service & Operations team in the role of **System Engineer.** You will be part of an ambitious team that works closely together to provide our customers with the best service and follow-up, both onsite and remote.


**In the role of System Engineer**, we want to give you firsthand experience of what it's like to work with technology at the forefront of the healthcare sector, and how we make a difference and impact lives in the community. This role also has a high focus on working with Ascom’s personal safety solutions for customers in the security segment, such as prisons.


**Job Responsibilities:**

* Participate in projects related to the establishment of new Ascom systems.
* Project/contract work, including commissioning and testing.
* Handling technical incidents of varying difficulty both onsite at the customer and via remote support.
* Troubleshoot and fix issues, both hardware (HW) and software (SW).
* Ensure high customer satisfaction with excellent follow-up, documentation, and report writing.
* Maintain good communication with the customer and a positive attitude.
* Manage systems based on critical communication and high security.
* Collaborate with other technicians and project managers in the team.
* Test and upgrade our customer solutions.
* Eventually participate in a 24/7 on-call schedule.
* Work within the security segment, including environments such as prisons.

**Requirements**:


* The role is security-classified, which means **you must undergo a security clearance and be approved** to take on the role.
* B-class driver's license.
* Willingness to travel.

**Technical Experience and Skills:**

* Technical Engineering: Mid-level (Practical education)
* Application Engineering: Mid-level (Practical education)
* H&S: Certified according to local regulations and Basic H&S awareness
* An engineering approach with connotations of precision, predictability, measurement, risk mitigation, and professionalism
* 5+ years’ experience in a technical System Engineering position or similar
* Experience with digital tools, good system understanding and experience with network hardware such as switches, routers, etc.
* Experience working in projects and customer service.
* Experience with the Windows platform (installation, configuration, setup, and operation).
* Knowledge of telecommunications and networking, including TCP/IP and SIP.
* Understanding and interest in GSM, 4G, Wi-Fi is beneficial but not required.
* Experience in the healthcare sector is an advantage.

**Personal** **Qualities:**

* Strong customer service skills and ability to write reports well.
* Analytical, structured, and quality-conscious.
* A team player, but also independent with the ability to plan your own workday and meet deadlines.
* Quick learner, with an affinity and interest in technical and IT-related subjects.
* Fluent in Swedish and good English skills, both written and spoken.

**We** **Offer:**

* The opportunity to influence and contribute to Ascom’s development
* A varied and rewarding workday that keeps you engaged and learning
* Flexible working hours and the possibility to work from home

Are you interested in becoming part of the team? We look forward to receiving your application!


Want to learn more about us? Read on here: www.ascom.com


*Ascom is an employer that promotes diversity, equality, and inclusion. We welcome applicants from all backgrounds and do not discriminate based on race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, age, marital status, veteran status, disability, or any other protected status. We believe that a diverse workforce strengthens our team, drives innovation, and enriches our workplace. Join us in creating an inclusive environment where everyone is valued and has equal opportunities to succeed.*
company_description: Ascom is a global solutions provider focused on Healthcare Information and Communication Technology (ICT) and mobile workflow solutions.

title: QA Engineer
description:
**Who we are ‍️**  

Welcome to Findity, the tech provider fueling Europe’s leading edge in expense management solutions! We empower over 30,000 corporate entities and more than 290,000 employees to conquer their financial challenges with ease. Join us in revolutionizing how businesses thrive in the digital age!

 **What we do**  

At Findity, we constantly strive to eliminate expense management for every individual and business so they can focus on what matters. Expense management is for many a must and not a want, that is why we partner with the leading software and financial institutes to eliminate the pain of dealing with expenses.

 **The role**  

We are looking for a skilled and driven QA engineer to further strengthen our QA capabilities, ensuring continuous delivery of high quality services to provide the best possible experience for our end customers.
  

  

As a member of the QA team, you will work closely with your QA colleagues and scrum team members in the Engineering department.


To enjoy your work and your role we believe you are a person with a curious and open mind. You enjoy troubleshooting and keeping up with new technologies and practices to drive improvements. You are a communicative and collaborative team-player who takes initiative and you are willing to challenge yourself and others in order for the team to grow and succeed.

 **Qualifications**

* Proven experience as a QA engineer or a similar role, with strong knowledge of software QA methodologies, tools and processes.
* An academic background in a relevant field.
* Experience in writing clear, concise and comprehensive test plans and test cases.
* Hands-on experience with automated testing tools (Selenium, Playwright, etc.).
* Strong analytical and problem-solving skills to identify and troubleshoot issues effectively.
* Solid knowledge of SQL and scripting
* Keen attention to detail and a commitment to delivering high-quality work within set timelines.
* Experience working in an Agile/Scrum development process
  

**Apply Now!**

Excited about embarking on your new career journey? Fantastic! Send us your application in English as soon as possible!

title: Detection Engineer
description:
Are you seeking a role as a Detection Engineer? At Orange Cyberdefense, you will work together with colleagues specialized in IT and cybersecurity to build a safer digital society. As an employee of a leading company in cybersecurity in Europe, you can make a real difference by analyzing and preventing security incidents among some of our largest companies.

**How we work**


The role of the Detection Engineer is to develop detection methods for our CyberSOC services, existing and new, with the purpose of defending against current threats.


They have responsibilities of our detection models and will maintain indicators related to our services with their corresponding applications.


During high severity global threats, they will react by researching and determining appropriate detection rules.


The role will assist in guiding by providing input to improve the quality of our delivered services.

  

It is possible to either work from one of our hubs in Europe or fully remotely!

**Key Responsibilities – Strategic**

* Continuously develop our detection models to improve the capabilities and quality.
* Monitor the results of our indicators from a global perspective, providing suggestions for improvement.
* Increase the quality of information presented to analysts and to counteract alert fatigue.
* Collaborate with relevant stakeholders to improve the quality and track the development of our services.

 **Key Responsibilities – Tactical/Operational**

* Develop new indicators for Managed Threat Detection services.
* Maintain the Splunk application included in our Managed Threat Detection (Log) service.
* Maintain and update our detection library.
* Gather statistics and investigate to determine potential improvements.
* Continuously test the detection capabilities of our services and related products.
* Maintain documentation related to detections and supported services.

**Who are you?**

* You have a strong passion for working with Splunk.
* You enjoy researching threats and exploring how to detect them, with hands-on experience in writing detections in SPL.
* You have a passion for technology and stay current with emerging security trends.
* You want to use your blue/red teaming experience to improve our abilities of detecting threats.

  

**Knowledge and Experience****Preferred**

* 3+ years of experience as a Security Analyst.
* Solid understanding of common threats and TTPs, with prior experience working with the MITRE framework (whether through threat hunting or gap analysis).
* Experience in creating and tuning detections.
* Familiarity with attack frameworks.
* Proficiency in SPL and experience working with CIM.
* Experience with Splunk components like KV stores, data models, and other elements used in data normalization.
* Understanding the anatomy of a Splunk app, with bonus points if you've built one or gained familiarity with its components.
* Experience with writing regular expressions.
* Experience working with Sysmon including developing and managing rules.
* Experience in Python development. You should be able to analyze code and write applications or scripts.

  

**Bonus**

* Experience in using version control software and CI/CD for managing detection rules.
* Experience with Red-teaming exercises
* Experience in developing and tuning detections in Sentinel, Defender and Cortex.
* Working with Infrastructure as Code using Terraform.

 **Our offer**


As an employee at Orange Cyberdefense, you will get the opportunity to work closely with some of the experts in the field and in an innovative and friendly company where we together contribute to the continued development of the company.


With the latest technology, customers in the Nordics region and a growing company supporting you, you are given the opportunity to create and contribute to a safer society.


Working at Orange Cyberdefense will give you the chance to develop both personally and professionally. New challenges are our favorite challenges. Orange Cyberdefense has an environment with a high rate of change, quick decision-making, combined with sensitivity to our employees. We believe that by providing an atmosphere where we try to have fun at work and love what we do, we will also get the best end results.

**How to join us**


Join us by sending your application through our application form. The selection is ongoing, and the position can be filled before the last application date.


We look forward to receiving your application!


**Contrat**
-----------
